As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions or feelings. However, here are some advantages of using a tablet over a traditional art medium for graphic design and digital artwork:

1. Digital tools provide more flexibility: With a tablet, artists can easily edit, copy, and manipulate their work. They can resize elements, change colors, and fix mistakes instantly. This saves time and allows for experimentation.

2. Portability: Tablets are lightweight and portable, allowing an artist to work on the go. They can easily carry their work with them and continue working from different locations.

3. Cost-effective: While the initial cost of a tablet may be high, in the long run, it can save money compared to traditional art supplies. Digital artwork can be created and stored on a computer, eliminating the need for physical storage space.

4. Improved workflow: Using a tablet can speed up the design process because a digital artist can switch between different tools and software applications easily. They can also use built-in templates and tools that make it easier to create a consistent look across various design projects.

5. Better precision: Digital tools provide more precision than traditional art mediums. With a tablet, artists can zoom in on specific details and make precise adjustments to their work. They can also use tools like the “Undo” function to quickly correct mistakes.

6. Collaboration: With a tablet, it's easier to collaborate with other artists and clients in real-time. They can share their work and ideas instantly, allowing for quick feedback and revisions.
